page.title: 16ECOLOGY - HARMSTON & COLEBY
page.content: {LAND FEATURES:}Limestone scarp edge falls 46 to 30 metres to the Witham- Brant vale. Spring line promotes rich slope pastures with heavy clay fields beyond, drained by pipes and dykes. Flat "heathland" gives good general purpose farmland; two sub-surface dry valleys drain NW to SE, saturated at Trent flood periods.Snow drifting and soil erosion are problems. {FLORA & FAUNA:}Ash trees dot mechanic- cut mixed hedges (mainly hawthorn). Deciduous trees plentiful in villages, parks and uncut hedges. Wide grass verges, some cut yearly, springs, dykes, trees and hedges provide habitats for robins, wrens, yellow- hammers, chaffinches and duck, hares, voles, rabbits, hedgehogs and foxes. Dead trees & copses usually replaced. Fertilisers, herbicides, insecticides & spraying increasingly & widely used.
